How do I get the .ron morph files to app: Download Trilogy Save Editor (from NexusMods) and in it open the save file containing your morph. Then go to the Head Morph tab and click Export. This will create a .ron file that you can then load into this tool.
How do I revert to the default BroShep/F: Selecte Default under Clone's Appearance for the clone you want. Note that any previously applied morphs will be removed, so you must select any morphs you want to use before hitting Apply.
Can I use the default appearance for eit: Yes. Select Default for the clone you want to have use the default appearance, and Custom for the other.
Can I apply a male morph to a female clo: No if you don't wanna see imploded heads.
I don't have access to/can't remember th: Simnply remove the lines that refer to them from your .ron file.
Does it matter if I'm using the alternat: Not at all. You can use either the normal or alternative versions of the mod without issue, as long as their version is compatible.
How do I add scars to my custom clone?: You need to add HED_Face_Alignment_Emis, HED_Face_Alignment_Norm, EYE_Diff texture paremeters using Face_EmisScars_0[1-5] textures, and add the HED_Emis_Intensity scalar parameter with a value between 0 to 5.
I choose scars when installing the mod,: The scars install options when installing the mod with Mod Manager control the scars for the Default Appearance, not for custom headmorphs.
Some color/texture doesn't look exactly: First of all check that it's not the lighting of the scene, since that can make some colors look a bit off. However, in rare ocasions some scalars don't translate the same to the clone, so try tweaking them in the .ron file. If that doesn't work, post a bug report in the Github page.
Can I use this tool after installing tex: Yes, provided that any required mods are installed pre-texture modding. You can even toggle between the custom and default appearances using this tool without issues.
I previously applied a morph for either: Whenever you apply a morph, the mod files are reset to avoid any issues, removing in the process any previously applied morph.
Can I use this tool while the game is ru: Yes, you can. However, if you apply a morph to change from Default to Custom, rather than replacing an existing one, you'll see the changes the next time you boot the game.
An Unhandled Exception occurred, what sh: Click the Copy button on the exception window, paste it in an online pastebin, then add it in a bug report in the Github page.
